meanings.definition: One who avoids or shuns something.
meanings.sent1: The eschewer of spicy food always opts for milder dishes.
meanings.sent2: The new student was an eschewer of loud parties.
meanings.sent3: The eschewer of vegetables found a creative way to hide them in their meals.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled detective, the eschewer of confrontation dodged every argument.
meanings.sent5: The eschewer of technology lived happily off the grid.

meanings.definition: To deliberately avoid or abstain from something.
meanings.sent1: She would eschewer sugary drinks to maintain a healthy diet.
meanings.sent2: The environmentalist chose to eschewer plastic bags in favor of reusable ones.
meanings.sent3: He decided to eschewer the elevator and take the stairs for exercise.
meanings.sent4: The author would eschewer distractions to focus on writing her novel.
meanings.sent5: In order to save money, they would eschewer eating out and cook at home instead.
